ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I really felt like I synthesized my learning from the past four years at Yale through the process of writing my senior essay.
Spending a full year researching and thinking about a single subject is deeply rewarding, and one of the best experiences Ive had at Yale.
How to write a paper of a wider and deeper scope
I learned how to write a sustained argument across 100 pages backed by extensive archival and in-person research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: there is not a huge amount of community among majors - it would be great to have regular meetings as a group.

I do think the Humanities could benefit from one mandatory class at the start of senior year which acts as a primer for writing the thesis, especially given that most students work among a couple of departments

The one-on-one structure is excellent and could only be improved, perhaps, by a few more partial paper deadlines. It would also be great to have a senior colloquium at the end of the year for Humanities majors to present their theses to each other.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend the year-long thesis option to all Humanities majors! It's incredibly important to learn how to engage in a sustained way through an extended idea. The thesis teaches time management, research, and communication skills. It was my most satisfying (and challenging) intellectual project at Yale.
